00031 /*
00032  * This is a short example program which shows how to use hashlib++.
00033  * It produces hashes for a given string or file.
00034  *
00035  * THIS PROGRAMM IS JUST AN EXAMPLE HOW TO USE HASHLIB++ AND
00036  * NO FULL IMPLEMENTED SOFTWARE!
00037  *
00038  * usage:
00039  *
00040  * [-s string] [-f filename]       
00041  *
00042  * Benjamin Grüdelbach
00043  * 
00044  * Di 18 Sep 2007
00045  */
00046 
00047 
00048 //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
00049 //hashlib++ includes
00050 #include "hashlibpp.h"
00051 
00052 //----------------------------------------------------------------------        
00053 //misc. includes
00054 #include <iostream>
00055 #include <string>
00056 
00057 //----------------------------------------------------------------------        
00058 //prototypes
00059 void printUsage (void);
00060 
00061 //----------------------------------------------------------------------        
00062 
00063 int main ( int argc, char **argv)
00064 {
00065         bool bCreateFromText = false;
00066         bool bCreateFromFile = false;
00067         std::string strInput = "";
00068 
00069         /*
00070          * just parse the cmdline
00071          */
00072         for( int i = 1; i < argc ; i++ )
00073         {
00074                 if( strcmp(argv[i],"-s") == 0 )
00075                 {
00076                         bCreateFromText = true; 
00077                         if( i != argc-1 )
00078                         {
00079                                 strInput = argv[i+1];
00080                                 break;
00081                         }
00082                 }
00083                 else if( strcmp(argv[i],"-f") == 0 )
00084                 {
00085                         bCreateFromFile = true; 
00086                         if( i != argc-1 )
00087                         {
00088                                 strInput = argv[i+1];
00089                                 break;
00090                         }
00091                 }
00092         }
00093 
00094         /*
00095          * just print out some little help
00096          * if no options have been submited
00097          */
00098         if( (bCreateFromText == false) &&
00099             (bCreateFromFile == false) )
00100         {
00101                 printUsage();
00102                 exit(0);
00103         }
00104         
00105         //--------------------------------------------------------------
00106         
00107 
00108         /*
00109          * We create some wrappers. 
00110          */
00111         hashwrapper *md5 = new md5wrapper();
00112         hashwrapper *sha1 = new sha1wrapper();
00113         hashwrapper *sha256 = new sha256wrapper();
00114         hashwrapper *sha384 = new sha384wrapper();
00115         hashwrapper *sha512 = new sha512wrapper();
00116 
00117         /*
00118          * these strings will hold our hashes
00119          */
00120         std::string sMD5 = "";
00121         std::string sSHA1 = "";
00122         std::string sSHA256 = "";
00123         std::string sSHA384 = "";
00124         std::string sSHA512 = "";
00125 
00126         if( bCreateFromText )
00127         {
00128                 /*
00129                  * producing hashes from the given string
00130                  */
00131                 sMD5 = md5->getHashFromString(strInput);
00132                 sSHA1 = sha1->getHashFromString(strInput);
00133                 sSHA256 = sha256->getHashFromString(strInput);
00134                 sSHA384 = sha384->getHashFromString(strInput);
00135                 sSHA512 = sha512->getHashFromString(strInput);
00136         }
00137         else if( bCreateFromFile )
00138         {
00139                 /*
00140                  * producing hashes from the given file
00141                  */
00142                 try
00143                 {
00144                         sMD5 = md5->getHashFromFile(strInput);
00145                         sSHA1 = sha1->getHashFromFile(strInput);
00146                         sSHA256 = sha256->getHashFromFile(strInput);
00147                         sSHA384 = sha384->getHashFromFile(strInput);
00148                         sSHA512 = sha512->getHashFromFile(strInput);
00149                 }
00150                 catch (hlException &e)
00151                 {
00152                         std::cerr << "Error(" 
00153                                   << e.error_number()
00154                                   << "): "
00155                                   << e.erro_message()
00156                                   << std::endl;
00157                         exit(e.error_number());
00158                 }
00159         }
00160 
00161         /*
00162          * output
00163          */
00164         std::cout << "Your hashes: " << std::endl; 
00165         std::cout << sMD5 << "(MD5)" << std::endl;
00166         std::cout << sSHA1 << "(SHA1)" << std::endl;
00167         std::cout << sSHA256 << "(SHA256)" << std::endl;
00168         std::cout << sSHA384 << "(SHA384)" << std::endl;
00169         std::cout << sSHA512 << "(SHA512)" << std::endl;
00170 
00171         delete md5;
00172         delete sha1;
00173         delete sha256;
00174         delete sha384;
00175         delete sha512;
00176 
00177         return 0;
00178 }
00179 
00180 //----------------------------------------------------------------------        
00181 
00182 void printUsage (void)
00183 {
00184         std::cout << std::endl;
00185         std::cout << "hashlib++ example program." << std::endl;
00186         std::cout << "This software produces all supported " << std::endl;
00187         std::cout << "hashes from a given string or file." << std::endl;
00188         std::cout << std::endl;
00189         std::cout << "usage: " << std::endl;
00190         std::cout << "[-s string] [-f filename]" << std::endl;
00191         std::cout << std::endl;
00192 }
